newsitem.title: UK: BOC shares gain after top-end results.
newsitem.headline: BOC shares gain after top-end results.

text.p: Shares in BOC Group Plc were quoted higher in pre-market trading on Tuesday, bouncing back from recent weakness after the company posted results at the top end of the range of analyst expectations.
The stock, which yesterday dropped 19-1/2p at one stage to its lowest intraday level since October 1995, was quoted up 14-1/2p at 850-1/2 by 0718 GMT.
"The numbers look fine, they are at the top of the range and they are probably good enough after the stock's turbulent recent past," said one senior equity salesman.
"There will be a palpable sigh of relief from those that have stood by BOC in recent months, when it has underperformed by some 15 percent."
"But the question is whether they are good enough to put what has been a pretty dismal performance behind it," the salesman said.
The industrial and medical gases group posted a rise in yearly pretax profit to 444.9 million stg from 402.2 million a year before and raised its dividend to 29.0p from 27.0p

Analyst pretax profit expectations had mostly been in a range between 421.0 million stg and 445.0 million and the dividend was expected to be between 27.0p and 29.0p. "While we expect another challenging year in health care, with pressure in the U.S. market continuing, expansion into other markets and some new product introductions should provide sales growth," said Danny Rosenkranz, chief executive.
The company said the economic backgroud was one of slower growth than last year in most key markets but on balance it remained strong.
North America and North Pacific still maintained respectable growth rates, it said, and it was "expecting a similar pattern for the year ahead."
